IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO BUILD SELF-SUFFICIENT LIVES FOR THE HEALTH OF OUR COMMUNITY,PROVIDE THE MOST ESSENTIAL NEEDS TO THOSE IN CRISIS, AND BUILD LONG-TERM STRATEGIES THAT WILL ENSURE SELF-SUFFICIENT LIVES TOMORROW.
IRS990.MissionDescription: UNITED WAY'S PRIMARY EXEMPT PURPOSE: ORANGE COUNTY UNITED WAYS MISSION IS TO BUILD SELF-SUFFICIENT LIVES FOR THE HEALTH OF OUR COMMUNITY. WE DO THAT BY SUPPORTING A SAFETY-NET OF CARE TO PROVIDE THE MOST ESSENTIAL NEEDS TO THOSE IN CRISIS TODAY AND BUILD LONG-TERM STRATEGIES AROUND EDUCATION AND FINANCIAL STABILITY THAT WILL ENSURE SELF-SUFFICIENT LIVES TOMORROW.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT HAVE ANY LOBBYING ACTIVITIES FOR THE YEAR; HOWEVER, FORM 5768, ELECTION/REVOCATION OF ELECTION BY AN ELIGIBLE SECTION 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION TO MAKE EXPENDITURES TO INFLUENCE LEGISLATION, WAS FILED WITH THE IRS FOR TAX YEAR 2007.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DONOR DESIGNATION AND DONOR DESIGNATION FEES
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCH D, PART XII, LINE 4B and SCH D, PART XIII, LINE 4B

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE PURPOSE OF THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS TO SUSTAIN THE MISSION OF ORANGE COUNTY'S UNITED WAY AS A VITAL COMMUNITY RESOURCE NOW AND INTO THE FUTURE. THE PRINCIPAL OBJECTIVE IS TO PROVIDE A SOURCE OF INCOME TO FUND OPERATIONAL COST.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: ORANGE COUNTY'S UNITED WAY MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS BY ENGAGING IN A FORMAL MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING WITH THE AGENCY REFERENCING THE FUNDED PROGRAM AND ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES. MID-YEAR AND YEAR-END REPORTS ARE REQUIRED AND ARE COMPARED TO ORIGINAL ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES. IN ADDITION, UPDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND AUDIT REPORTS ARE REQUIRED. ANY PERFORMANCE PROBLEMS WITH THE GRANTEE ARE MONITORED BOTH BY STAFF AND THE COMMUNITY IMPACT COMMITTEE.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Identifier: COMPENSATION - HEALTH OR SOCIAL CLUB DUES
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE MEMBERSHIP IS USED TO CONDUCT BUSINESS RELATED MEETINGS AND ENGAGEMENTS TO FURTHER ADVANCE THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION UTILIZES AN UNRELATED OUTSIDE THIRD PARTY TO PROCESS AND SELL NON-CASH SECURITIES AND VEHICLE DONATIONS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION B Q.12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, TRUSTEES AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANNUALLY INTERESTS THAT WOULD GIVE RISE TO CONFLICTS. CONFLICT STATEMENTS ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY AND ANY STATED CONFLICT IS REVIEWED BY THE BOARD DEVELOPMENT COMMITTEE AND BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION B, LINE 15B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THIS MEMORANDUM SERVES TO SUMMARIZE THE GENERAL PHILOSOPHY AND PROCESS BY WHICH THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE ("THE COMMITTEE") OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OPERATES. THE COMMITTEE IS COMPRISED OF INDEPENDENT DIRECTORS RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL GOVERNANCE AND OVERSIGHT OF COMPENSATION FOR THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES AND TO INSURE THAT THE TOTAL COMPENSATION PROGRAM FOR THE CEO AND OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES SUPPORTS OCUW'S VISION AND STRATEGIC OBJECTIVES. OCUW'S EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO ENCOURAGE RETENTION OF HIGH CALIBER EXECUTIVES, BE FLEXIBLE IN REWARDING INDIVIDUAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS AS WELL AS ORGANIZATIONAL SUCCESS, PROVIDE A COMPETITIVE COMPENSATION PACKAGE AND ENSURE THAT THE PROGRAM COMPLIES WITH STATE AND FEDERAL LEGISLATION, INCLUDING THE REBUTTABLE PRESUMPTION OF REASONABLENESS. TO THIS END, THE COMMITTEE CONSIDERS NUMEROUS FACTORS INCLUDING OCUW'S MISSION AND GOALS, COMPARABLE COMPENSATION OFFERED IN SIMILARLY SIZED ORGANIZATIONS AND THE PERFORMANCE OF THE CEO AND KEY EMPLOYEES. OCUW COMMISSIONED A REPORT PREPARED BY MERCER CONSULTING WHICH WAS REVIEWED BY THE COMMITTEE. THIS REPORT PROVIDED COMPARABLE DATA RELATIVE TO BASE SALARY AND TOTAL COMPENSATION (BASE SALARY, ANNUAL BONUS OPPORTUNITY AND RETENTION INCENTIVE). THE MERCER REPORT USED NATIONAL DATA FOR SIMILARLY SITUATED NOT FOR PROFIT AND FOR PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. ADDITIONAL DATA REVIEWED BY THE COMMITTEE CAME FROM THE ECONOMIC RESEARCH INSTITUTE (WHICH IS ASSOCIATED WITH GUIDESTAR). THIS DATA WAS PULLED FROM THE 990'S OF SIMILAR NON PROFITS WITHIN A 35 MILE RADIUS OF OCUW. FINALLY, THE COMMITTEE REVIEWED SURVEY DATA PROVIDED BY UNITED WAY WORLDWIDE. THE COMMITTEE ALSO REVIEWED THE PERFORMANCE INCENTIVE PROGRAM. THIS PLAN IS DESIGNED TO REWARD PERFORMANCE BASED ON BOTH QUANTIFIABLE SPECIFIC ORGANIZATIONAL DRIVERS. FINALLY, THE COMMITTEE REVIEWED AND DETERMINED OTHER COMPENSATION WHICH INCLUDES HEALTH AND WELFARE BENEFITS AND CONTRIBUTIONS TO A QUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN AND DEFERRED COMPENSATION. THE COMMITTEE REVIEWED AND APPROVED THE COMPENSATION FOR THE PRINCIPAL FINANCIAL OFFICER. SURVEY DATA INCLUDED COMPARABLES PROVIDED BY UNITED WAY WORLDWIDE, DATA FROM THE ECONOMIC RESEARCH INSTITUTE AND LOCALLY PROVIDED SURVEY DATA FOR ACCOUNTING PROFESSIONALS. IN SUMMARY, THE COMMITTEE BELIEVES THE COMPENSATION PROGRAM AND INFORMATION DESCRIBED ABOVE IS IN LINE WITH ORANGE COUNTY UNITED WAY'S MISSION AND GOALS AND ACCURATELY REFLECTS A COMPETITIVE PROGRAM TO ATTRACT AND RETAIN HIGH LEVEL EXECUTIVES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: DISCLOSURE - GOVERNING DOCS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY & FINANCIALS
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION C, Q.19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE; WHEREAS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND THE TAX RETURN ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: GOVERNING BODY & MGMT - REVIEW OF FORM 990
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION A, LINE 10
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE VICE PRESIDENT/CONTROLLER OF FINANCE WORKED CLOSELY WITH THE TAX PREPARER IN THE PREPARATION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX RETURN. THE FINAL PRODUCT WAS REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO FILING.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION A, Q.2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: AL DEGRASSI AND THOMAS ROGERS SHARE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: EXEMPT PURPOSE ACHIEVEMENTS OF 3 LARGEST PROGRAM SERVICES
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMMUNITY IMPACT: OUR GOAL IS TO CREATE LONG LASTING CHANGE BY ADDRESSING ISSUES BEFORE THEY BECOME PROBLEMS. WE PROVIDE BASIC SERVICES NEEDED FOR INDIVIDUALS IN CRISIS TO SITUATIONS AND PROACTIVELY ADDRESS THE ROOT CAUSES PREVENTING PEOPLE FROM LIVING FINANCIALLY SELF SUFFICIENT LIVES. THIS IS ACHIEVED BY SUPPORTING PROGRAMS WHICH FOCUS ON EDUCATION AND FINANCIAL STABILITY AND MOVING PEOPLE FROM DEPENDENCY TO SELF SUFFICIENCY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: EXEMPT PURPOSE ACHIEVEMENTS OF 3 LARGEST PROGRAM SERVICES
EXEMPT PURPOSE ACHIEVEMENTS OF 3 LARGEST PROGRAM SERVICES
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CONTRIBUTIONS DESIGNATED TO SPECIFIC 501(C)3 ORGANIZATIONS BY INDIVIDUAL DONORS AND CORPORATIONS

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: VOTING MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990 PART I LINE 3 & 4 AND PART VII
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE DISCREPANCY BETWEEN THE NUMBER OF VOTING MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY AND THE TOTAL MEMBERS LISTED ON PART VII IS DUE TO SOME DIRECTORS BECOMING INACTIVE BEFORE THE END OF THE YEAR.
